metadata.Title: CVE-2010-5313 on Ubuntu 14.04 ESM (trusty) - medium.
metadata.Description:
Race condition in arch/x86/kvm/x86.c in the Linux kernel before 2.6.38 allows L2 guest OS users to cause a denial of service (L1 guest OS crash) via a crafted instruction that triggers an L2 emulation failure report, a similar issue to CVE-2014-7842.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2010-5313` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-3.11.0-12-generic - 3.11.0-12.19
linux-image-3.11.0-12-generic-lpae - 3.11.0-12.19
linux-image-extra-3.11.0-12-generic - 3.11.0-12.19
No subscription required

linux-image-3.16.0-25-generic - 3.16.0-25.33~14.04.2
linux-image-3.16.0-25-generic-lpae - 3.16.0-25.33~14.04.2
linux-image-3.16.0-25-lowlatency - 3.16.0-25.33~14.04.2
linux-image-3.16.0-25-powerpc-e500mc - 3.16.0-25.33~14.04.2
linux-image-3.16.0-25-powerpc-smp - 3.16.0-25.33~14.04.2
linux-image-3.16.0-25-powerpc64-emb - 3.16.0-25.33~14.04.2
linux-image-3.16.0-25-powerpc64-smp - 3.16.0-25.33~14.04.2
linux-image-extra-3.16.0-25-generic - 3.16.0-25.33~14.04.2
No subscription required

linux-image-3.19.0-18-generic - 3.19.0-18.18~14.04.1
linux-image-3.19.0-18-generic-lpae - 3.19.0-18.18~14.04.1
linux-image-3.19.0-18-lowlatency - 3.19.0-18.18~14.04.1
linux-image-3.19.0-18-powerpc-e500mc - 3.19.0-18.18~14.04.1
linux-image-3.19.0-18-powerpc-smp - 3.19.0-18.18~14.04.1
linux-image-3.19.0-18-powerpc64-emb - 3.19.0-18.18~14.04.1
linux-image-3.19.0-18-powerpc64-smp - 3.19.0-18.18~14.04.1
linux-image-extra-3.19.0-18-generic - 3.19.0-18.18~14.04.1
No subscription required

linux-image-3.11.0-12-generic - 3.11.0-12.19
linux-image-3.11.0-12-generic-lpae - 3.11.0-12.19
linux-image-extra-3.11.0-12-generic - 3.11.0-12.19
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

notes.Note: jdstrand> android kernels (flo, goldfish, grouper, maguro, mako and manta) are not supported on the Ubuntu Touch 14.04 preview kernels linux-lts-saucy no longer receives official support linux-lts-quantal no longer receives official support

criterions.comment: linux package in trusty, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '3.11.0-12.19').
linux-flo: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue.
linux-goldfish: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue.
linux-grouper: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue.
linux-lts-utopic package in trusty, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '3.16.0-25.33~14.04.2').
linux-lts-vivid package in trusty, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '3.19.0-18.18~14.04.1').
linux-maguro: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue.
linux-mako: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue.

linux-signed package in trusty, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '3.11.0-12.19').
